intro: Paepalanthus manicatus var. pulvinatus, commonly known as the pink pincushion cactus, is a unique species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, spiny, pinkish-red stems that form a compact, cushion-like structure. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months, which are typically clustered at the tips of the stems. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its distinctive appearance and slow growth make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
